text: ALICE PERRY (30s), her innate and amiable authority eclip only by a self-consciousness about her hair, afraid perha that she hasn't lived up to the promise of its red color, chalks "Futur Anterieur" in precise cursive at the board.

"By tomorrow, we will have flown to France." She turns to face her TENTH GRADE FRENCH CLASS. Though Alice's make up, earrings and practical flats are simple, there is an inherent elegance to their combinatio that hints at a more complex, if uncharted, interior.
Who can give me an example? Paul? NOTE: Throughout, all blocks of italicized dialogue shoul read as in FRENCH with ENGLISH subtitles.
"I will have completed the assigned translation by the end of vacation."
C'est bon! Amber?
I will have failed French again by the end of the year. Alice pauses, regarding Amber with a pained sympathy.
En francais si'l vows plait?
So, the definition of the derivative of the function "f" at point "x" is..?
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 2.

EMMA LINDGARD (late 20's) rapidly scribbles a complex  calculus formula at the board while all of her TWELFTH GR MALE STUDENTS avidly admire her shape in a tight, stylish skirt and heels. She turns suddenly, smiling brightly.
Okay! Kyle? KYLE snaps his eyes up to Emma's face, tries to cover.
Um... I guess I'm a little lost. If optimists see a glass as half full, Emma's is in a constant state of cheerful, blonde overflow, even when a level of wilfulness is required.
Try to follow along. I really want you guys to get this! David? DAVID gazes back dumbly, stuck in an erotic fog.
Cindy?

TWO GIRLS ( 17) laugh conspiratorially, dredging woven po holders through an egg mixture and dropping them into a sputtering pan, as the rest of the CLASS makes French toa The girls sneak looks at MEG KELLY (30's) who tears recip from a Gourmet magazine at her desk at the front of the r Dark hair pulled into a pony tail, face unadorned by make Meg's natural sexiness is muted by an air of indifference She glances up when the pan erupts in flames and the girl leap back with a shriek, shakes her head. The girls attempt to knock the pan from the burner with t handle of a broom when a pot lid bangs down, instantly snuffing the flames. They shrink back as Meg waves the lid, clearing the smoke
Do me a favor, and let's just try to get to vacation. The class bell RINGS!
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 3.
You can burn the school down as soon as we're back.

Alice, a heavy bag slung over her shoulder, and her boyfr RICHARD (30's, scruffily handsome in sweats and a coach's jersey), carrying three binders and a bag of baseball bat exit the school among a crush of students. Together, they cross a lawn dotted with patches of late s to the parking lot, stopping at Alice's weathered Volvo w Richard hands over the binders with a kiss.
Got practice until five thirty, then I'll be by.
I'll see you then. Thanks. They kiss again and Richard takes off for the athletic fields, passing Meg as she comes from the school, waves.
Hey, Meg! Bon voyage! Alice offers a binder to Meg as she arrives at Alice's ca
I finished our travel binders! Meg takes the binder, looks it over.
Remind me again why we're taking phonebooks to France? Alice gives her a look.
I love my binder. I do.
Where's Emma? She knows we're meeting, right?
Forgot her purse. (watching the students)
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 4.
You know, for the first time in a long time, I feel just as lucky as  any of these kids. They may have their whole lives ahead of them but we've got a week in Paris.
Oh, that's right. I keep forgetting your life is completely over. So sad. I'm really going to miss you.
Funny.
Well, that was a close call! They turn to see Emma. crossing the parking lot holding a quality knock-off designer handbag over her head.
Look at her. The only teacher in Racine County that wears four inch heels in six feet of snow.
She always looks great, doesn't she?
Damn her.
My passport was in here!
Where'd you find it?
Second floor girl's bathroom. Right where I left it. This
Ooh, binders! Great! Alice passes one to Emma.
You guys were so nice to ask me to come with--
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 5.
Emma, we're a team.
I'd just be sitting around the condo, trolling e-Harmony...
The fact that you have trouble finding a date--
I'm telling you, it's this town!
Gives me less than no hope.

You know what we should do, Meg? When we're over there? we should all treat ourselves. Find a real salon. Total spa treatment. And I'm gonna get my hair done. Just like this! She holds up a European tabloid she's pulled from her pur stabbing a finger at a photograph: CORDELIA WINTHROP SCOT (30's), a blonde heiress deflecting paparazzi in couture. NOTE: EMMA and CORDELIA are Played by the same actress.
Look at us. Meg and Emma turn to Alice, smiling.
We're really going.

Alice's passport and a brochure emblazoned with a logo: Esprit de Corps Tours, sit on top of her dresser, next to framed photo of Alice and Richard at the Wisconsin Dells. Alice struggles to close the overstuffed suitcase on her tugging at the stubborn zipper.
Come on... Please... please...
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 6.
The zipper tears away from the suitcase witha loud RIP! i
Meg pulls a well-worn stuffed dog from her open suitcase the couch, holding it up to her daughter, FINN (6) who we a spangled tutu and cowboy boots.
She wants to see Paris, too!
Finn, if Edith goes to Paris with me, she can't go to Daddy's with you. Finn's brows come together as she considers this, then reaches for the dog.
That's what I thought.
Seamus! SEAMUS, Meg's ten year old son, pounds down the stairs carrying an enormous backpack as Meg zips her bag closed.
Toothbrush? Seamus makes a face, drops his bag and heads back up the stairs as the doorbell rings.
Daddy!
GLENN (30s), in a police uniform, watches Meg squeeze her children tightly.
Remember. Gameboy goes to bed when you do. Nine o'clock.
Seam, why don't you take your sister to the car while your mom and I talk.
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 7.
Can we get on the radio?
No. No. Meg watches her kids run to the squad car parked at the c just as KARYN (30's, also in uniform) emerges on the passenger side to meet them.
And no lights!
Hey, Meg! Meg lifts her chin in greeting, but that's it.
I uh... I heard from my lawyer. She said you'd signed your papers. Meg watches her kids climb in the car with Karyn.
Guess that makes us official, then.
You and me? (a nod to the car) Or...
You and me, Meg. A beat as they look at one another, hold.
Mom! Seamus reappears, charging up the walk to pull Meg down t his level, hugging her.
Have fun.
Emma's packed suitcases stand neatly arranged by the door the sparsely furnished, undecorated room.
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 S.
You have no messages. Leaning on the lip of the kitchen's bar, Emma presses the record button on her answering machine, then speaks with put-on, coolly sophisticated,'jet-setting accent.
Hello. You've reached the home of Emma Lindgard. I'm afraid I won't be able to return your call right away, as I'm currently traveling. In Europe. But, please, do leave a message.
". .She was known as 'The People's Princess'... Emma turns at the counter to see Princes Diana touring an African encampment with children on the television.

Ooh! She hangs up the phone and sits herself down at the coffe table where a game of solitaire is laid next to a microwa Lean Cuisine dinner. She turns up the volume with the remote and gathers the cards, shuffling. Eyes glued to Princess Diana on television, Emma suddenly shoots her hands three feet wide, rifling the cards in perfect vertical formation like a seasoned cardsharp.
Alice opens the door, kissing Richard who holds up a suit in one hand, a bottle of champagne in the other.
Special delivery.
Alice zips the suitcase shut and raises her arms in victo as Richard pours the Champagne into two glasses.
That's it! I am good to go!
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 9.
Richard brings a glass to Alice, nuzzles her ear.
I'm proud of you, you know. Alice takes her glass and presses Richard down onto the b climbing on top of him.
Like Christmas when I was a kid. There's no way I'm going to be able to sleep tonight--
Good for me. They kiss.
I mean, how long have I been talking about this?
Mmm... You were reading Colette. In the teacher's lounge. First time we met. Long time. Alice pauses as this lands somewhere deep inside.
This is just the beginning.
It feels like it. They clink glasses and Richard watches Alice tip her glas back then stop mid-sip to peer down at the delicate diamo ring sitting at the bottom of her glass.
Oh. Richard... It's so... It's beautiful... Richard takes her glass and fishes out the ring.
Let's try it on.
But, we can't even celebrate--
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 10.
What are you talking about? We're
But, I'm leaving. I'm--. I'm getting on a plane in the morning.
Maybe I want to make sure you come
(stops, sobers) Wait. You're serious. Are you serious? You're serious.
Let's do this when I get back. In a week.
Can you hear yourself?
Honey, listen, it's just the timing. I wasn't planning on this
Whoa. I planned tonight. Tonight was my plan--

And it's great. This is great. You're great. But, Richard, I feel like I just need to do this one thing first. Then I can do the next. Then I can do this. (off his silence) Can you understand? There's a world I haven't even seen yet... Alice, hopeful, searches Richard's inscrutable expression beat, then he turns away and gets up, ring in hand.
I thought we'd be seeing it together. (pockets the ring) Have a great trip, Alice. He heads for the door.
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 11.
Richard, come on. You're leaving?
(without looking back) Maybe I'll see you in a week. Alice listens to his footfalls and the slam of the front door, then falls back on the bed, striking her head on th open suitcase, wincing.
I'm sorry...
Ladies and Gentleman, we are about to begin our descent into Charles de Gaulle International Airport...

Meg sleeps in an aisle seat of the dim coach cabin where the window shades have been drawn down, Emma dozing besid her, a game of cards laid out on her tray table. Alice brings her seat to the upright position as instruct and sits, hyper-alert, looking at her closed window shade A beat. She reaches out and raises the shade a tentative crack, flooding their row with light. She glances furtively around the cabin, then inches the s higher, drawing in a sharp breath at what she sees. She flings the shade up. ALL OF PARIS is laid out below her; a magical nautilus-li wheel with the Eiffel Tower as its central axle. Her breath steams the window as she drinks it all in. She turns, eyes full, to Meg who cranes across Emma to sh in the view and squeeze Alice's arm with a smile.
Are we there?! 0

A CUSTOMS AGENT stamps Alice's passport with a thump. CUSTOMS AGENT
Bien venue. Alice looks up from her imprinted passport, smiles hugely ALICE
Merci .
Alice emerges with Meg and Emma, each struggling with the luggage, onto the thronged arrivals deck. EMMA

There it is! Esprit de Corps! Alice looks to where Emma points, seeing a small sky-blue flag at the end of a long staff held by MADAME VALERY (40 pinched) their harried tour guide in a suit of the same b ALICE
Excuse me, are you Madame Valery? 0
Madame Valery glances up from her clipboard beside their ALICE (CONT'D)
Hi, my name is Alice Perry-- MADAME VALERY (GESTURING)
Bags go under the bus. ALICE
I'm traveling with my friends, Meg Kelly and Emma Lindgard-- MADAME VALERY (FLAT)
I speak English. EMMA
Well, that's great! ALICE
We're so excited! Madame Valery eyes Alice unfolding a map from her binder. (CONTINUED)

Now, I was hoping you could tell me which route the bus will be taking-- MADAME VALERY (WEARILY PREDICTIVE)
You're not going to be a problem, are you?
The battered Esprits de Corps Tours bus careens through t streets, listing wildly from side to side.
MADAME VALERY
(over bus's P.A.) On your right... Alice, squashed beside Meg on the over-crowded bus, whips head up from her guidebook.
Was the Arc de Triomphe. ALICE
This is ridiculous... EMMA
Hey, Alice! Meg! Alice and Meg turn to Emma across the aisle, who hooks a thumb at CARL and DEEDEE (late 60's, both stout) beside h EMMA (CONT'D)
Can you believe? They're from St. Paul! On their honeymoon! CARL
Waited a long time for this! But, we finally made it! EMMA
Alice, that's like you! (back to couple) We're here celebrating my friend Meg's divorce! 0
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 14.
The bus hurtles around the drive, screeching to a halt, bouncing roughly on its shocks at the museum's entrance.

Alice, Meg and Emma race past gallery after gallery, tryi to keep Madame Valery's little blue flag in sight as it f over the crowd in the distance. Alice whipsaws her head at everything they're missing, ma notes in her guidebook on the fly. ALICE
Try to remember that! We'll double back for the Chagalls!

Madame Valery leads the charge up the right wing of the D staircase, past the statue of Winged Victory. Alice stops Meg and Emma in front of the statue, while Ca and Deedee try to catch their breath on the landing. ALICE (READING FAST)

.Also called Nike of Samothrace. Greek goddess Nike, meaning victory. Two-twenty to one-ninety B. C. Okay, go! They head for the right stairs just as Madam Valery reappears, descending with her group on the left. ALICE (CONT'D)
Oh. Alice turns Meg and Emma around to come back down. DEEDEE
Well, that saved us a climb.
Emma elbows her way out of a crush of raised cameras and cellphones to Alice and Meg who strain at the rear of the CROWD to view a painting, all but the top of its gold fra obscured. (CONTINUED)
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 15. CONTINUED: EMMA
(waving her camera) I got it! I got it!
Meg and Emma sit hunched over Emma's camera and its shaky digital image of the Mona Lisa, squeezed in with Alice an the rest of their tour at too few tables. EMMA
Alice, I'll e-mail it to you. Meg looks up, catching Alice eyeing their surroundings. MEG
(re: Mona Lisa) At least she's smiling. ALICE
(snaps to, smiling) What? No. I'm--. I'm just a little tired. EMMA
(a happy idea) Hey! I'll bet you have jet lag! We'll probably all get it! Meg raises a glass of wine. MEG
To jet lag. Emma and Alice raise their glasses to toast as WAITERS pl down identical plates of steak frites before them. MEG (CONT'D)
To Alice. Best organizer. Best guide. Best friend. EMMA
To Alice! They clink glasses and Alice is suddenly jostled, just as she's about to sip, by Carl as he turns from the table be her, spilling her wine. DEEDEE
Oh, Carl! (CONTINUED)
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 16. CONTINUED: CARL
I am so sorry! ALICE
(mopping her front) IT'S OKAY-- DEEDEE
He was just looking for the catsup- CARL
If you're not using it. As Emma passes the bottle of catsup, Meg offers Alice her napkin, and waiters sweep their plates away, replacing th with creme brulees. ALICE
Oh! No. Wait. Pardon, Monsieur-- CARL (RECEIVING CATSUP)
Merci! He turns now, catsup in hand, to blink at the creme brule that has replaced his own and Deedee's steaks. Alice places a hand on Madam Valery's arm as she passes. ALICE
Pardon, Madame, but... Madam Valery slowly raises her eyes from Alice's hand. ALICE (CONT'D)
I'm sorry, but-- MEG
Are you apologizing? ALICE
They've taken our dinners away-- Madame Valery taps her watch and then her clipboard. MADAME VALERY
There were stragglers at the. museum. Now, I am behind schedule. 0

Esprit de Corps tour members disembark from their bus in front of a comically narrow and vertical Baroque hotel wi its name in feeble buzzing neon: Le Petit Sommeil. ALICE (PRE-LAP)
Look! Look at this picture and tell me what's different!

The women lower the travel brochure and its photograph of tidy well-appointed suite, to regard the actual one in wh they stand; dingy, impossibly small, crowded by an armoir that nearly meets the low sloping ceiling, with two spind twin beds and a military-style cot. EMMA
Toujour le suck-ez vous. ALICE
I researched at least a million TOURS-- MEG
Well. This is the one we could afford. A beat as they consider the room and their lot in life. MEG (CONT'D)
It's only five nights-- EMMA
Five nights? Here?! MEG
And, Alice, you said yourself, we'll hardly ever be in our room. (SELLING IT)
It'll be like camping. At Eagle River. It'll be fun! Emma opens what is essentially a closet with a toilet. EMMA
Here's your outhouse, Meg. Go nuts. Alice joins Emma at the bathroom door. (CONTINUED)
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 18. CONTINUED:
Me? I'm going to try to hold it. MEG
Okay, Emma. Let's just unpack-- she turns for the luggage, nearly falling over at the wei of Emma's suitcase as she reaches to lift it. MEG (CONT'D)
Holy--! Alice, help-- Alice climbs onto one of the beds to help Meg lift. ALICE

Just the stuff you put on my list-- (off her look) And a couple options. The bag slips from Meg's grasp, crashing onto the foot of bed which collapses, catapulting Alice onto the cot which flips up over her, knocking Emma into the tiny bathroom. EMMA (CONT'D)
Hey! Come on, guys!

Alice gazes out a window that opens onto a narrow alley a the ugly backsides of buildings, as Meg and Emma sleep fitfully behind her. She looks down at the cellphone in her hands, scrolling through her speed dial to stop at: 1. Richard. She hesitates with her thumb over the "call" button. She turns back to the miserable view, considering for a b then folds her phone away as she blinks back tears.
Madame Valery leads a diminished flock, bobbing her staff with its blue flag, in a forced march across the span of ornate pedestrian bridge toward the waiting tour bus. (CONTINUED)
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 19. CONTINUED:

The Pont des Arts has it's name for the vast number of art students that come here to paint this famous city view... Meg and Emma, the worse for wear, trail Madame Valery at distance with Alice who now leads her own handful of tour members, Carl and Deedee among them. ALICE

It's called the Pont des Arts because the Louvre was formally known as the Palais des Arts... Madame Valery stops ahead, turning back to take in Alice her cluster of appreciative followers. MADAME VALERY
People! We must keep together!
Alice's group circles an inscribed stone medallion with a star-shaped brass inset on the pavement outside Notre Dam DEEDEE
"Point zero. Dez roots dee France." ALICE
It's from right here that all the highway miles in all of France are measured. They also say that if you stand on this exact spot, you are be destined to return to France in the future. MEG
Oh, I'm in! Come on. Everyone! Together, they all step forward, arms entwined, laughing. EMMA

I want a picture! Of all of us! Alice looks up as Emma breaks away, to see Madam Valery leading her dwindling group from the great church. Madame Valery sends her charges to the bus, then heads straight for Alice as Emma tries to enlist a JAPANESE COU to take a group photo with her camera. (CONTINUED)
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 20. CONTINUED: MADAME VALERY
My head count was short in the cathedral. ALICE
I'm sorry. I was explaining about POINT ZERO--
Madame Valery sizes Alice up and taps her staff as the gr forms around them, joined by the Japanese couple. MADAME VALERY
This flag? I do not carry it for my pleasure. ALICE
We were just on our way inside-- MADAME VALERY
Well, now you may head to the bus. ALICE
But, we haven't been-- MADAME VALERY
Which is why you must follow my  flag! ALICE
okay. We will. I promise. But, these people haven't seen the CATHEDRAL--- MADAME VALERY
There are many churches on the tour. ALICE
But, this is Notre Dame! They need to see this-- MADAME VALERY
I assure you, they will see everything they need to see-- ALICE (LOSING IT)
Well, what's the point if it's all a big fat blur? When nobody can see anything properly? Let alone experience it, or appreciate-- (CONTINUED)
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 21. CONTINUED: (2)
You seem quite the Paris expert, for someone who has never been. EMMA
Ill bet she knows more about it than you! The Japanese wife frames the action with Emma's camera. ALICE
I might not have ever been here before, but... (EMOTIONAL)
I've waited my whole life for this trip. CARL
We've waited thirty years-- MEG
You tell her, Carl. ALICE
You keep rushing us through, like this is some kind of race-- (REALLY HURT)
And you won't even speak French with me. (SGUARES HERSELF)

Now, I think I've been very nice. We're from Wisconsin. But, I'm telling you, I am not getting on that bus until my friends and I have seen Notre Dame. Meg and Emma exchange looks as Alice plants herself with folded arms and steely resolve before Madame Valery. MADAME VALERY
Perhaps, if Madame is not satisfied with my tour she could conduct her own. EMMA

What'd she say? Alice's eyes narrow in regarding Madame Valery and all fa silent a beat; a crowd anticipating fireworks. CLICK! The Japanese wife snaps a picture of the standoff, the sound of the shutter triggering Alice to action. (CONTINUED)

Whoa! Madame Valery, nonplussed, reaches out to reclaim her fla but Alice jerks it further away, while the Japanese woman snaps picture after picture. DEEDEE
Carl, we're getting on the bus! Madame Valery lunges for the stick.
The bus pulls away, revealing the Japanese couple who ret Emma's camera with a bow, Meg, and Alice holding the flag EMMA
That was fantastic! MEG
"A" plus! Alice, cheeks flushed, watches Carl waving goodbye from t 0
bus's rear window. MEG (CONT'D)
Alice, you okay? Alice brings the staff down across her knee, snapping it two, casting the broken ends into the gutter as she raise herself to her full height. ALICE
Now, the real tour can begin! MEG
Let's kick this town's ass! Alice marches forward as a few drops of rain fall. EMMA
I think it's starting to rain-- ALICE
Who cares? We're in Paris! What's a little rain? 0
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 23.

Water pours in sheets from the sky as Alice, Meg and Emma splash down the Rue de Rivoli and duck beneath the shelte the hotel's canopy. They shake water from their arms and hair, pluck at their sopping clothes. PHOTOGRAPHER 1

Cordelia! They glance over at a few PAPARAZZI sharing the protectio the overhang on the far side of the entrance, as a camera flashes in taking Emma's picture. Emma smiles, blinks, confused as another photographer admonishes the first. PHOTOGRAPHER 2
You're wasting your film. That's not her. EMMA
What're they saying? Alice looks about in equal confusion, but stops short whe she sees the opulent restaurant behind the window's glass ALICE
Oh. Meg and Emma turn to gape as well at the DINERS and elega tables inside as the rain hammers down. ALICE (CONT'D)
That, mes aims, is Paris. EMMA
You think they'd let me use the bathroom?
Meg and Emma step into the lobby, a palatial world of mar gold and flowers, as Alice confers with the DOORMAN. EMMA
Wow. 0 (CONTINUED)

Merci. (joins Emma and Meg) Okay, Emma, it's down the hall to the left. Meg and I'll go and get us a table-- EMMA
Meet you in there. Emma heads for the ladies room, gaping at the lobby. EMMA (CONT'D)
Wow... MEG
Get us a table? Alice, we can't afford to eat here-- ALICE
My treat. ME G

(hooking Meg's arm) We're going to do one thing right in Paris. I don't care how much it costs. They turn for the dining room, passing the front desk whe CORDELIA WINTHROP SCOTT (dressed similarly to Emma, thoug ten times the cost) unleashes her ire on the CONCIERGE. CORDELIA
And, just how do you propose I am to travel tomorrow, then? CONCIERGE
I am sorry, but, there is nothing-- A MANAGER enters from the back. MANAGER
Mademoiselle Scott, I have checked and there is no sign of a package-- (CONTINUED)

Marvelous. I'd like to see someone who speaks English, please. If there is such a person in France. The concierge and manager look to one another and back. MANAGER
This is not English we are speaking?
Emma swings through the door into the black marble bathro grabbing a towel to swipe at her wet hair. She stops abruptly, examines the towel. EMMA
These are cloth! She takes the towel into one of the stalls, closing the d behind her just as Cordelia strides in, stops at the coun CORDELIA (ACID DISGUST)
France. Cordelia's cellphone RINGS! and she pulls it from her pur
Hello? CORDELIA (INTO PHONE)
You would not believe these people. So rude! She takes her phone into the stall next to Emma's and clo the door just as Alice and Meg enter.

Alice and Meg look at one another in the mirror, overhear Cordelia, as they pick up towels to dry off.

Emma?
Yeah. I'm here.

I don't know. Some auction. One of those foundations--. But, have I heard from them? No. And they were to take care of the plane--. Well, I'm certainly not going to go if, Wait, where are you? (LISTENS)

Reykjavik? Would I need a coat? A toilet flushes and Cordelia opens her stall door, heads the counter, oblivious to Alice and Meg who freeze with t towels, blinking at her uncanny resemblance to Emma. CORDELIA (CONT'D)
Do you know if there's an evening flight--? Alice and Meg turn to each other, then to Cordelia's reflection in the glass, their mouths hanging open. CORDELIA (CONT'D)

Let me call you when I get to the airport. It may take awhile... She gives Alice and Meg a devastating look up and down. CORDELIA (CONT'D)

It appears to be raining outside. Quite hard. She picks up her purse and exits without looking back jus Emma opens her stall door and joins Alice and Meg, who ga at her with towels in their hands. EMMA
Did you see those are cloth? Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 27.
MEG
No, Emma, I mean, exactly like you. EMMA
Well, she sounded awful. And kind of mean. Alice, Meg and Emma, punchy and a little drunk, enjoy win from enormous glasses as they finish their meals. ALICE
(draining her glass) She should be ashamed. Can you imagine having a room here and then not staying in it? An ANXIOUS WAITER races in, refilling Alice's glass. EMMA (PERFECT MIMIC)

We should just take it. Her room. EMMA
And her trip to Monte Carlo! (TO ALICE)
That's still France, right? MEG
Alice, how fast can you get a binder going on a trip like that? ALICE (LAUGHS)
Oh, I'd love to see that. Us in Monte Carlo. MEG

Remind me to have Daddy buy this hotel so that I can knock it down. Alice and Meg laugh with Emma as the waiters head for the kitchen in panic. WAITER
(whispers to other) She is a monster! MEG
Emma, you could be her! EMMA (MIMICKING)
Darling, Meg. Always making me laugh! (DROPPING IT)
Who in their right mind would ever believe that I was-- MANAGER
Pardon, Mademoiselle Scott? The three look up at the manager in surprise. ALICE
I'm so sorry. Were we being too loud? MANAGER
No, no, we are all very happy to see Mademoiselle Scott smile... A WINE STEWARD hustles up to the table with an ice bucket stand and a bottle of Champagne. MANAGER (CONT'D)
Please. In apology for our earlier misunderstanding. EMMA
Our misunder--?  (CONTINUED)
Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 29. CONTINUED: (2) MANAGER
Your dinners as well. With our compliments... The three women exchange glances as the steward begins to open the bottle and the manager bows, backing away. EMMA
